title.narrative: PROGRAMMATIC ENVIRONMENT, POLICY/LEGAL FRAMEWORKS

description.narrative: By 2019, the programmatic environment at national and local levels is strengthened with adequate policy and legal frameworks in line with international standards., which contributes to Access To Justice, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 70% of children (girls and boys), the most vulnerable in priority intervention areas, are protected from violence, including in emergency situations, and families adopt protective behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, the programmatic environment at national and local levels is strengthened with adequate policy and legal frameworks in line with international standards.

description.narrative: The legal and institutional framework on the protection of children was improved with a view to offering a quality service to rights-holders. Thus, adoption by the National Assembly of the Law on the Revised Children's Code provides specific answers to concerns related to child marriage, justice for children and violence against children. This improvement was also reflected, at the operational level, by the definition of national strategies on the promotion of the abandonment of FGM (2019–2023) and the signing of a protocol on interoperability between the health and civil status sectors. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
